# Class GraphOutputStreamResponse<T>

Represents a response from a graph output stream. This class contains all possible data types that can be returned from graph nodes during execution. Each type serves a specific purpose in the graph processing pipeline.

#### Type Parameters

  * T extends CustomNodeInputTypes = CustomNodeInputTypes



##### Index

### Constructors

constructor

### Properties

data done

### Methods

processResponse

## Constructors

### constructor

  * new GraphOutputStreamResponse<T extends unknown = any>(  
data: T,  
done?: boolean,  
): [GraphOutputStreamResponse]()<T>

Creates a new GraphOutputStreamResponse instance.

#### Type Parameters

    * T extends unknown = any

#### Parameters

    * data: T

The graph output stream data, if available

    * done: boolean = false

Whether the graph has finished executing. When true, indicates that the graph execution has completed and no more data will be streamed.

#### Returns [GraphOutputStreamResponse]()<T>




## Properties

### data

data: T

The graph output stream data, if available

### done

done: boolean = false

Whether the graph has finished executing. When true, indicates that the graph execution has completed and no more data will be streamed.

## Methods

### processResponse

  * processResponse(  
handlers: {  
ClassificationResult?: ProcessResponseHandler<ClassificationResult>;  
Content?: ProcessResponseHandler<Content>;  
ContentStream?: ProcessResponseHandler<ContentStream>;  
Custom?: ProcessResponseHandler<object>;  
default?: ProcessResponseHandler<any>;  
done?: ProcessResponseHandler<void>;  
GoalAdvancement?: ProcessResponseHandler<GoalAdvancement>;  
KnowledgeRecords?: ProcessResponseHandler<KnowledgeRecords>;  
ListToolsResponse?: ProcessResponseHandler<ListToolsResponse>;  
LLMChatRequest?: ProcessResponseHandler<LLMChatRequest>;  
MatchedIntents?: ProcessResponseHandler<MatchedIntents>;  
MatchedKeywords?: ProcessResponseHandler<MatchedKeywords>;  
MemoryState?: ProcessResponseHandler<MemoryState>;  
SpeechChunkStream?: ProcessResponseHandler<SpeechChunkStream>;  
string?: ProcessResponseHandler<string>;  
TextStream?: ProcessResponseHandler<TextStream>;  
ToolCallResponse?: ProcessResponseHandler<ToolCallResponse>;  
TTSOutputStream?: ProcessResponseHandler<TTSOutputStream>;  
},  
): Promise<void>

Processes the graph output stream response with type safety using a visitor pattern. This function makes it easy to handle different response types in a switch-like pattern.

#### Parameters

    * handlers: {  
ClassificationResult?: ProcessResponseHandler<ClassificationResult>;  
Content?: ProcessResponseHandler<Content>;  
ContentStream?: ProcessResponseHandler<ContentStream>;  
Custom?: ProcessResponseHandler<object>;  
default?: ProcessResponseHandler<any>;  
done?: ProcessResponseHandler<void>;  
GoalAdvancement?: ProcessResponseHandler<GoalAdvancement>;  
KnowledgeRecords?: ProcessResponseHandler<KnowledgeRecords>;  
ListToolsResponse?: ProcessResponseHandler<ListToolsResponse>;  
LLMChatRequest?: ProcessResponseHandler<LLMChatRequest>;  
MatchedIntents?: ProcessResponseHandler<MatchedIntents>;  
MatchedKeywords?: ProcessResponseHandler<MatchedKeywords>;  
MemoryState?: ProcessResponseHandler<MemoryState>;  
SpeechChunkStream?: ProcessResponseHandler<SpeechChunkStream>;  
string?: ProcessResponseHandler<string>;  
TextStream?: ProcessResponseHandler<TextStream>;  
ToolCallResponse?: ProcessResponseHandler<ToolCallResponse>;  
TTSOutputStream?: ProcessResponseHandler<TTSOutputStream>;  
}

Object containing handler functions for each type

#### Returns Promise<void>

The result from the appropriate handler

#### Example


```
const result = response.visit(&#123;  string: (text) =&gt; `Got text: $&#123;text&#125;`,  Custom: (custom) =&gt; `Got custom data: $&#123;JSON.stringify(custom)&#125;`,  TextStream: async (stream) =&gt; &#123;    // Handle stream...    return "Processed stream";  &#125;,  // Add other handlers as needed  default: (value) =&gt; &#123;    console.log(`Unknown type received from stream.`);  &#125;,&#125;);

```
